Updated November     pm



Ray Dorr  fought Lou Gehrigs disease since he was diagnosed in the spring of  PERIOD Yesterday morning the quarterback coach for the UW Huskies from  to  died in his home in College Station Tex PERIOD

The announcement of his death came as little surprise to those that knew Dorr PERIOD He had fallen around Christmas and stayed in an intensive care unit before going home for the last six weeks of his life PERIOD

Dorr while serving under coach Don James at Washington Dorr trained future NFL quarterbacks Chris Chander Tom Flick and Warren Moon PERIOD

 said James PERIOD

The nine years Dorr spent at the UW were his longest stretch at any one school PERIOD He left the UW when he was offered the head coaching position at Southern Illinois University PERIOD He first worked with James at Kent State where James was coach PERIOD

In recognition of Dorr James and Dorrs other football friends threw him a party at the annual coaches conference in Anaheim last summer PERIOD

 said Roger Hart defensive line coach for the UW PERIOD Hart did not work with Dorr but was one of his better acquaintances still at the UW PERIOD

Lou Gehrig disease or amyotpophoc lateral sclerosis is a progressive fatal neurological disease affecting as many as  Americans with  new cases occurring in the United States each year PERIOD It effects the brains control of muscle strength and causes increasing weakness leading to paralysis PERIOD
